result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan J. Bessa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Obstructing/Resisting. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:05 a.m. Defendant Jordan J. Bessa in court with attorney William Allen Dickens. Michael Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 16CF102 & 16CV80. Plea Questionnaire and Waivers filed. In 15CF State moves to dismiss but read in Cts. 1, 2, 5; moves to amend Ct. 4 to ordinance resisting at $263.50. In 16CF102, State moves to amend Ct. 1 to first offence 961.41(3g)(e), dismiss Ct. 2. Court grants State's motions to dismiss and amend. Defendant pleads no contest to remaining charges. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 as amended in 15CF297 and Ct. 1 as amended. Schiek statement to sentencing. Dickens statement to sentencing-requests day-to-day credit for inpatient treatment if jail ordered and delay reporting for 30 days. Court statement to sentencing - special disposition Ct. 3 upon successful completion/does find harmful to public. The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). Court dismisses 16CV80 - $765 forfeited will be returned to DA - ordered that $60 be returned to NORDEG and remaining $705 to be applied to fines/costs. 

WHS - Ct. 3 in 15CF297
2 yrs. POP
30 days jail commence on or before 4/21/17 at 8:00 a.m. -- may serve in Oneida or Vilas County
Will allow day-for-day credit for inpatient treatment
2 days' credit
Huber
CC/CV/supervision fees and surcharges
DNA sample
Special disposition s. 973.015 upon successful completion
Appeal rights

16CF102 - Ct. 1 - concurrent with 15CF297
2 yrs. POP
CC/CV/supervision & surcharges
No condition jail - 2 days' credit
Appeal rights
